intro: Microlicia petiolulata, commonly known as the small-petioled mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from its host through its haustoria. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, which can adhere to the bark of host trees. Microlicia petiolulata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its host species.
